H5892 עִיר ʻîyr eer or (in the plural) עָר; or עָיַר; (Judges 10:4), from עוּר; a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post); Ai (from margin), city, court (from margin), town. 		עִירִֽי׃‘î-rî. of my city N-fsc | 1cs
51 My eye affects my heart because of all the daughters of my city.Lamentations 3:51
Stats
Counts: 70 characters, 13 words, 57 letters, 23 vowels, 34 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עֵינִי֙ עֹֽולְלָ֣ה לְנַפְשִׁ֔י מִכֹּ֖ל בְּנֹ֥ות עִירִֽי׃ ס

Lit: My eyes bring suffering to my soul because of all the daughters of my city

KJV: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.
References

"eye"
Ge 44:34: For how will I go up to my father: and the lad be not with me? lest perhaps I see the evil that will come on my father.
1Sa 30:3: 4: So David and his men came to the city: and: look: it was burned with fire; and their wives: and their sons: and their daughters: were taken captives.
Jer 4:19-21: My bowels: my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart makes a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace: because you have heard: O my soul: the sound of the trumpet: the alarm of war.
Jer 14:18: If I go forth into the field: then look the killed with the sword! and if I enter into the city: then look them that are sick with famine! yes: both the prophet and the priest go about into a land that they not know.
Lu 19:41-44: When he was come near: he beheld the city: and wept over it:

"mine heart"
La 1:18: The LORD is righteous; for I have rebelled against His commandment: hear: I pray you: all people: and look my sorrow: my virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.
La 2:21: The young and the old lie on the ground in the streets: my virgins and my young men are fallen by the sword; you have killed them in the day of your anger; you have killed: and not pitied.
La 5:11: They ravished the women in Zion: and the maids in the cities of Judah.
Jer 11:22: Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: Look: I will punish them: the young men will die by the sword; their sons and their daughters will die by famine:
Jer 14:16: The people to whom they prophesy will be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they will have none to bury them: them: their wives: nor their sons: nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.
Jer 19:9: I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters: and they will eat every one the flesh of his friend in the siege and straitness: wherewith their enemies: and they that seek their lives: will straiten them.

Stats

Translation
Hebrew: צֹ֥וד צָד֛וּנִי כַּצִּפֹּ֖ור אֹיְבַ֥י חִנָּֽם׃

Lit: Down Hunted me like a bird My enemies without cause

KJV: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
References

"chased"

Jer 38:4-6: Therefore the princes said to the king: We beseech you: let this man be put to death: for thus he weakens the hands of the men of war that remain in this city: and the hands of all the people: in speaking such words to them: for this man seeks not the welfare of this people: but the hurt.

"without"

Ps 35:7: 19: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit: which without cause they have digged for my soul.
Ps 69:4: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head: they that would destroy me: being my enemies wrongfully: are mighty: then I restored that which I not took away.
Ps 109:3: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
Ps 119:161: SCHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart stands in awe of your word.

Joh 15:25: But this comes to pass: that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law: They hated me without a cause.

56 You have heard my voice: not hide your ear at my breathing, at my cry.Lamentations 3:56
Stats
Counts: 72 characters, 13 words, 55 letters, 20 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: קֹולִ֖י שָׁמָ֑עְתָּ אַל־תַּעְלֵ֧ם אָזְנְךָ֛ לְרַוְחָתִ֖י לְשַׁוְעָתִֽי׃

Lit: My voice You have heard not do hide Your ear from my sighing from my cry for help

KJV: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
References

"hast"

Job 34:28: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come to him: and he hears the cry of the afflicted.
Ps 3:4: I cried to the LORD with my voice: and He heard me out of His holy hill. Selah.
Ps 6:8: 9: Depart from me: all you workers of iniquity; for the LORD has heard the voice of my weeping.
Ps 34:6: This poor man cried: and the LORD heard Him: and saved Him out of all His troubles.
Ps 66:19: But truly God has heard me; He has attended to the voice of my prayer.
Ps 116:1: 2: I love the LORD: because He has heard my voice and my supplications.
Isa 38:5: Go: and say to Hezekiah: Thus says the LORD: the God of David your father: I have heard your prayer: I have seen your tears: look: I will add to your days 15 years.

"hide"

Ps 88:13: 14: But to you have I cried: O LORD; and in the morning will my prayer prevent you.
Ro 8:26: Likewise the Spirit also helps our infirmities: for we not know what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself makes intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.

Lit: You drew near on the day I called on You and said not do fear

KJV: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

"drewest"

H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עָלָֽי׃‘ā-lāy. against me Prep | 1cs
61 You have heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;Lamentations 3:61
Stats
Counts: 78 characters, 11 words, 63 letters, 26 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שָׁמַ֤עְתָּ חֶרְפָּתָם֙ יְהוָ֔ה כָּל־מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֖ם עָלָֽי׃

Lit: You have heard their reproach Yahweh all their schemes against me

KJV: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;
References

"Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;"
La 3:30: He gives his cheek to him that smites him: he is filled full with reproach.
La 5:1: Remember: O LORD: what is come upon us: consider: and look our reproach.
Ps 74:18: Remember this: that the enemy has reproached: O LORD: and that the foolish people have blasphemed your name.
Ps 89:50: Remember: Lord: the reproach of your servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
Zep 2:8: I have heard the reproach of Moab: and the revilings of the children of Ammon: whereby they have reproached my people: and magnified themselves against their border.

Lit: The lips of my enemies and their whispering against me all the day

KJV: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
References

"lips"
Ps 59:7: 12: Look: they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who: say they: does hear?
Ps 140:3: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips. Selah.
Eze 36:3: Therefore prophesy and say: Thus says the Lord GOD; Because they have made you desolate: and swallowed you up on every side: that you might be a possession to the residue of the heathen: and you are taken up in the lips of talkers: and are an infamy of the people:

"and"
Jer 18:18: Then said they: Come: and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law will not perish from the priest: nor counsel from the wise: nor the word from the prophet. Come: and let us smite him with the tongue: and let not us give heed to any of his words.

Stats
Counts: 76 characters, 12 words, 60 letters, 22 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תָּשִׁ֨יב לָהֶ֥ם גְּמ֛וּל יְהוָ֖ה כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: Repay them a recompense Yahweh According to the work of their hands

KJV: Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.
References

"Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands."
Ps 28:4: Give them according to their deeds: and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.
Jer 11:20: But: O LORD of hosts: that judge righteously: that try the reins and the heart: let me see your vengeance on them: for to you have I revealed my cause.
Jer 50:29: Call together the archers against Babylon: all you that bend the bow: camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she has done: do to her: for she has been proud against the LORD: against the Holy one of Israel.
2Ti 4:14: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward Him according to His works:
Re 6:10: They cried with a loud voice: saying: How long: O Lord: holy and true: do you not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?
Re 18:6: Reward her even as she rewarded you: and double to her double according to her works: in the cup which she has filled fill to her double.

65 Give them sorrow of heart, your curse to them.Lamentations 3:65
Stats
Counts: 47 characters, 8 words, 37 letters, 13 vowels, 24 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תִּתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ מְגִנַּת־לֵ֔ב תַּאֲלָֽתְךָ֖ לָהֶֽם׃

Lit: Give them veiled a heart Your curse be upon them

KJV: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.
References

"sorrow"
De 2:30: But Sihon king of Heshbon not would let us pass by Him: for the LORD your God hardened His spirit: and made His heart obstinate: that He might deliver Him into your hand: as appeareth this day.
Isa 6:10: Make the heart of this people fat: and make their ears heavy: and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes: and hear with their ears: and understand with their heart: and convert: and be healed.

"thy"
De 27:15-26: Cursed be the man that makes any graven or molten image: an abomination to the LORD: the work of the hands of the craftsman: and puts it in a secret place. And all the people will answer and say: Amen.
Ps 109:17: 18: As he loved cursing: so let it come to him: as he not delighted in blessing: so let it be far from him.
1Co 16:22: If any man not love the Lord Jesus Christ: let Him be Anathema Maranatha.

66 Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.Lamentations 3:66
Stats
Counts: 71 characters, 13 words, 58 letters, 21 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תִּרְדֹּ֤ף בְּאַף֙ וְתַשְׁמִידֵ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת שְׁמֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ פ

Lit: Pursue in Your anger and destroy them from under the heavens of Yahweh

KJV: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
References

"Persecute"
La 3:43: You have covered with anger: and persecuted us: you have killed: you have not pitied.
Ps 35:6: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the LORD persecute them.
Ps 73:15: If I say: I will speak thus; look: I should offend against the generation of your children.

"under"
De 7:24: He will deliver their kings into your hand: and you will destroy their name from under heaven: there will no man be able to stand before you: until you have destroyed them.
De 25:19: Therefore it will be: when the LORD your God has given you rest from all your enemies round about: in the land which the LORD your God gives you for an inheritance to possess it: that you will blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven; you will not forget it.
De 29:20: The LORD not will spare Him: but then the anger of the LORD and His jealousy will smoke against that man: and all the curses that are written in this book will lie upon Him: and the LORD will blot out His name from under heaven.
2Ki 14:27: The LORD not said that He would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven: but He saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Joash.
Jer 10:11: Thus will you say to them: The gods that not have made the heavens and the earth: even they will perish from the earth: and from under these heavens.

"heavens"
Ps 8:3: When I consider your heavens: the work of your fingers: the moon and the stars: which you have ordained;
Ps 115:16: The heaven: even the heavens: are the LORD's: but the earth has He given to the children of men.
Isa 66:1: Thus says the LORD: The heaven is my throne: and the earth is my footstool: where is the house that you build to me? and where is the place of my rest?

4
The Siege of Jerusalem

1 How is the gold become dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the stones of the sanctuary are poured out in the top of every street.Lamentations 4:1
Stats
Counts: 133 characters, 25 words, 104 letters, 40 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֵיכָה֙ יוּעַ֣ם זָהָ֔ב יִשְׁנֶ֖א הַכֶּ֣תֶם הַטֹּ֑וב תִּשְׁתַּפֵּ֙כְנָה֙ אַבְנֵי־קֹ֔דֶשׁ בְּרֹ֖אשׁ כָּל־חוּצֹֽות׃ ס

Lit: How has become dim the gold How changed the fine gold are scattered the stones of the sanctuary at the head of every street

KJV: How is the gold become dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the stones of the sanctuary are poured out in the top of every street.
References

"How is the gold"
2Ki 25:9: 10: He burnt the house of the LORD: and the king's house: and all the houses of Jerusalem: and every great man's house burnt He with fire.
Isa 1:21: How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
Isa 14:12: How are you fallen from heaven: O Lucifer: son of the morning! how are you cut down to the ground: which did weaken the nations!
Eze 7:19-22: They will cast their silver in the streets: and their gold will be removed: their silver and their gold will not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the LORD: they will not satisfy their souls: neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.

"the stones"
La 2:19: Arise: cry out in the night: in the beginning of the watches pour out your heart like water before the face of the Lord: lift up your hands toward Him for the life of your young children: that faint for hunger in the top of every street.
Jer 52:13: Burned the house of the LORD: and the king's house; and all the houses of Jerusalem: and all the houses of the great men: burned He with fire:
Mt 24:2: Jesus said to them: See you not all these things? truly I say to you: There will not be left here one stone upon another: that will not be thrown down.
Mr 13:2: Jesus answering said to Him: Seest you these great buildings? there will not be left one stone upon another: that will not be thrown down.
Lu 21:5: 6: As some spoke of the temple: how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts: he said:

2 The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold, how are they esteemed as earthen pitchers, the work of the hands of the potter!Lamentations 4:2
Stats
Counts: 131 characters, 21 words, 104 letters, 40 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י צִיֹּון֙ הַיְקָרִ֔ים הַמְסֻלָּאִ֖ים בַּפָּ֑ז אֵיכָ֤ה נֶחְשְׁבוּ֙ לְנִבְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶשׂ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְדֵ֥י יֹוצֵֽר׃ ס

Lit: The sons of Zion precious Valuable as fine gold how are they regarded as pots clay the work of the hands of the potter

KJV: The precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold, how are they esteemed as earthen pitchers, the work of the hands of the potter!
References

"sons"
Isa 51:18: There is none to guide her among all the sons whom she has brought forth; neither is there any that takes her by the hand of all the sons that she has brought up.
Zec 9:13: When I have bent Judah for me: filled the bow with Ephraim: and raised up your sons: O Zion: against your sons: O Greece: and made you as the sword of a mighty man.

"how"
La 2:21: The young and the old lie on the ground in the streets: my virgins and my young men are fallen by the sword; you have killed them in the day of your anger; you have killed: and not pitied.
La 5:12: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders not were honoured.
Isa 30:14: He will break it as the breaking of the potters' vessel that is broken in pieces; he will not spare: so that there will not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth: or to take water withal out of the pit.
Jer 19:11: will say to them: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Even so will I break this people and this city: as one breaks a potter's vessel: that cannot be made whole again: and they will bury them in Tophet: till there be no place to bury.
Jer 22:28: Is this man Coniah a despised broken idol? is he a vessel wherein is no pleasure? for what reason are they cast out: he and his seed: and are cast into a land which they not know?
Ro 9:21-23: Has not the potter power over the clay: of the same lump to make one vessel to honour: and another to dishonour?
2Co 4:7: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels: that the excellency of the power may be of God: not and of us.
2Ti 2:20: But in a great house there not are only vessels of gold and of silver: but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour: and some to dishonour.

3 Even the sea monsters draw out the breast, they give suck to their young ones: the daughter of my people is become cruel, like the ostriches in the wilderness.Lamentations 4:3
Stats
Counts: 159 characters, 26 words, 127 letters, 49 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּם־ [תַּנִּין כ] (תַּנִּים֙ ק) חָ֣לְצוּ שַׁ֔ד הֵינִ֖יקוּ גּוּרֵיהֶ֑ן בַּת־עַמִּ֣י לְאַכְזָ֔ר [כִּי כ] [עֵנִים כ] (כַּיְעֵנִ֖ים ק) בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ ס

Lit: Even the jackals present their breasts to nurse their young the daughter of my people But is cruel ostriches Like ostriches in the wilderness

KJV: Even the sea monsters draw out the breast, they give suck to their young ones: the daughter of my people is become cruel, like the ostriches in the wilderness.

"the daughter"

Isa 49:15: Can a woman forget her sucking child: that she not should have compassion on the son of her womb? yes: they may forget: yet will not I forget you.
Jer 19:9: I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters: and they will eat every one the flesh of his friend in the siege and straitness: wherewith their enemies: and they that seek their lives: will straiten them.

4 The tongue of the sucking child cleaves to the roof of his mouth for thirst: the young children ask bread, and no man breaks it to them.Lamentations 4:4
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: דָּבַ֨ק לְשֹׁ֥ון יֹונֵ֛ק אֶל־חִכֹּ֖ו בַּצָּמָ֑א עֹֽולָלִים֙ שָׁ֣אֲלוּ לֶ֔חֶם פֹּרֵ֖שׂ אֵ֥ין לָהֶֽם׃ ס

Lit: Clings the tongue of the infant to the roof of its mouth for thirst the young children ask for bread But breaks [it] no one for them

KJV: The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth to the roof of his mouth for thirst: the young children ask bread, and no man breaketh [it] unto them.

5 They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets: they that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.Lamentations 4:5
Stats
Rank: #4167 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 114 characters, 18 words, 94 letters, 34 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הָאֹֽכְלִים֙ לְמַ֣עֲדַנִּ֔ים נָשַׁ֖מּוּ בַּחוּצֹ֑ות הָאֱמֻנִים֙ עֲלֵ֣י תֹולָ֔ע חִבְּק֖וּ אַשְׁפַּתֹּֽות׃ ס

Lit: Those who ate delicacies Are desolate in the streets Those who were brought up in scarlet Embrace ash heaps

KJV: They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets: they that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.

6 For the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom, that was overthrown as in a moment, and no hands stayed on her.Lamentations 4:6
Stats
Rank: #5308 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 179 characters, 33 words, 142 letters, 52 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּל֙ עֲוֹ֣ן בַּת־עַמִּ֔י מֵֽחַטַּ֖את סְדֹ֑ם הַֽהֲפוּכָ֣ה כְמֹו־רָ֔גַע וְלֹא־חָ֥לוּ בָ֖הּ יָדָֽיִם׃ ס

Lit: And is greater the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people than the punishment of the sin of Sodom which was overthrown in a moment and with no to help her hand

KJV: For the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom, that was overthrown as in a moment, and no hands stayed on her.
References

"punishment of the iniquity of the daughter"
Isa 1:9: 10: Except the LORD of hosts had left to us a very small remnant: we should have been as Sodom: and we should have been like to Gomorrah.
Eze 16:48-50: As I live: says the Lord GOD: Sodom your sister has not done: she nor her daughters: as you have done: you and your daughters.
Mt 11:23: 24: you: Capernaum: which are exalted to heaven: will be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works: which have been done in you: had been done in Sodom: it would have remained until this day.
Lu 10:12: But I say to you: that it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom: than for that city.
Lu 12:47: That servant: which knew his lord's will: and not prepared himself: neither did according to his will: will be beaten with many stripes.

"the punishment"
La 4:9: They that be killed with the sword are better than they that be killed with hunger: for these pine away: stricken through for want of the fruits of the field.
Ge 19:25: He overthrew those cities: and all the plain: and all the inhabitants of the cities: and that which grew upon the ground.
Da 9:12: He has confirmed his words: which he spoke against us: and against our judges that judged us: by bringing upon us a great evil: for under the whole heaven has not been done as has been done upon Jerusalem.
Mt 24:21: For then will be great tribulation: such as not was since the beginning of the world to this time: no: nor ever will be.

7 Her Nazarites were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk, they were more ruddy in body than rubies, their polishing was of sapphire:Lamentations 4:7
Stats
Rank: #7789 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 138 characters, 21 words, 111 letters, 40 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: זַכּ֤וּ נְזִירֶ֙יהָ֙ מִשֶּׁ֔לֶג צַח֖וּ מֵחָלָ֑ב אָ֤דְמוּ עֶ֙צֶם֙ מִפְּנִינִ֔ים סַפִּ֖יר גִּזְרָתָֽם׃ ס

Lit: Were brighter Her Nazirites than snow and whiter than milk they were more ruddy in body than rubies Like sapphire in their appearance

KJV: Her Nazarites were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk, they were more ruddy in body than rubies, their polishing was of sapphire:

"Nazarites"

Jg 13:5: 7: For: indeed: you will conceive: and bear a son; and no rasor will come on His head: for the child will be a Nazarite to God from the womb: and He will begin to deliver Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.
Jg 16:17: That He told her all His heart: and said to her: There has not come a rasor upon my head; for I have been a Nazarite to God from my mother's womb: if I be shaven: then my strength will go from me: and I will become weak: and be like any other man.
Am 2:11: 12: I raised up of your sons for prophets: and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus: O you children of Israel? says the LORD.
Lu 1:15: For He will be great in the sight of the Lord: and will drink neither wine nor strong drink; and He will be filled with the Holy Ghost: even from His mother's womb.

"purer"

Ps 51:7: Purge me with hyssop: and I will be clean: wash me: and I will be whiter than snow.
Ps 144:12: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones: polished after the similitude of a palace:
Song 5:10: My beloved is white and ruddy: the chief among 10000.
Da 1:15: At the end of 10 days their countenances appeared fairer and fatter in flesh than all the children which did eat the portion of the king's meat.

8 Their visage is blacker than a coal; they not are known in the streets: their skin cleaves to their bones; it is withered, it is become like a stick.Lamentations 4:8
Stats
Rank: #6325 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 150 characters, 25 words, 117 letters, 46 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: חָשַׁ֤ךְ מִשְּׁחֹור֙ תָּֽאֳרָ֔ם לֹ֥א נִכְּר֖וּ בַּחוּצֹ֑ות צָפַ֤ד עֹורָם֙ עַל־עַצְמָ֔ם יָבֵ֖שׁ הָיָ֥ה כָעֵֽץ׃ ס

Lit: Now is blacker than soot their appearance not they go unrecognized in the streets clings their skin to their bones as dry it has become as wood

KJV: Their visage is blacker than a coal; they are not known in the streets: their skin cleaveth to their bones; it is withered, it is become like a stick.
References

"visage"
La 5:10: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.
Job 30:17-19: 30: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
Joe 2:6: Before their face the people will be much pained: all faces will gather blackness.
Na 2:10: She is empty: and void: and waste: and the heart melts: and the knees smite together: and much pain is in all loins: and the faces of them all gather blackness.

"they"
La 4:1: 2: How is the gold become dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the stones of the sanctuary are poured out in the top of every street.
Ru 1:19: 20: So they two went until they came to Bethlehem. And it came to pass: when they were come to Bethlehem: that all the city was moved about them: and they said: Is this Naomi?
Job 2:12: When they lifted up their eyes afar off: and knew not him: they lifted up their voice: and wept; and they tear every one his mantle: and sprinkled dust upon their heads toward heaven.
Isa 52:14: As many were astonied at you; his visage was so marred more than any man: and his form more than the sons of men:

"their skin"
Job 19:20: My bone cleaves to my skin and to my flesh: and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
Job 33:21: His flesh is consumed away: that it cannot be seen; and his bones that not were seen stick out.
Ps 32:4: For day and night your hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.
Ps 38:3: There is no soundness in my flesh because of your anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.
Ps 102:3-5: 11: For my days are consumed like smoke: and my bones are burned as an hearth.
Ps 119:83: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; yet do not I forget your statutes.

9 They that be killed with the sword are better than they that be killed with hunger: for these pine away, stricken through for want of the fruits of the field.Lamentations 4:9
Stats
Counts: 160 characters, 24 words, 124 letters, 42 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹובִ֤ים הָיוּ֙ חַלְלֵי־חֶ֔רֶב מֵֽחַלְלֵ֖י רָעָ֑ב שֶׁ֣הֵ֤ם יָז֙וּבוּ֙ מְדֻקָּרִ֔ים מִתְּנוּבֹ֖ת שָׂדָֽי׃ ס

Lit: Better off are Those slain by the sword Than those who die of hunger for those pine away Stricken for [lack of the fruits of the field

KJV: They that be slain with the sword are better than [they that be] slain with hunger: for these pine away, stricken through for [want of] the fruits of the field.
References

"for"

Eze 24:23: your tires will be upon your heads: and your shoes upon your feet: you will not mourn nor weep; but you will pine away for your iniquities: and mourn one toward another.
Eze 33:10: Therefore: O you son of man: speak to the house of Israel; Thus you speak: saying: If our transgressions and our sins be upon us: and we pine away in them: how should we then live?

11 The LORD has accomplished His fury; He has poured out His fierce anger, and has kindled a fire in Zion, and it has devoured the foundations thereof.Lamentations 4:11
Stats
Counts: 152 characters, 24 words, 122 letters, 48 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּלָּ֤ה יְהוָה֙ אֶת־חֲמָתֹ֔ו שָׁפַ֖ךְ חֲרֹ֣ון אַפֹּ֑ו וַיַּצֶּת־אֵ֣שׁ בְּצִיֹּ֔ון וַתֹּ֖אכַל יְסֹודֹתֶֽיהָ׃ ס

Lit: Has fulfilled Yahweh His fury He has poured out fierce His anger and He kindled a fire in Zion and it has devoured its foundations

KJV: The LORD hath accomplished his fury; he hath poured out his fierce anger, and hath kindled a fire in Zion, and it hath devoured the foundations thereof.

Lu 21:22: For these be the days of vengeance: that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

"kindled"

Lit: They wandered blind in the streets they have defiled themselves with blood so that no one would touch their garments

KJV: They have wandered as blind [men] in the streets, they have polluted themselves with blood, so that men could not touch their garments.

"have wandered"

Isa 56:10: His watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant: they are all dumb dogs: they cannot bark; sleeping: lying down: loving to slumber.
Isa 59:9-11: Therefore is judgment far from us: neither does justice overtake us: we wait for light: but look obscurity; for brightness: but we walk in darkness.

Mt 15:14: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind: both will fall into the ditch.

"they have polluted"
Nu 35:33: So you will not pollute the land wherein you are: for blood it defiles the land: and the land cannot be cleansed of the blood that is shed therein: but by the blood of him that shed it.
Isa 1:15: When you spread forth your hands: I will hide my eyes from you: yes: when you make many prayers: I not will hear: your hands are full of blood.
Jer 2:34: Also in your skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents: I not have found it by secret search: but upon all these.

"so that men could not touch"
Nu 19:16: whoever touches one that is killed with a sword in the open fields: or a dead body: or a bone of a man: or a grave: will be unclean 7 days.
Ho 4:2: By swearing: and lying: and killing: and stealing: and committing adultery: they break out: and blood touches blood.

 ס֣וּרוּ טָמֵ֞א קָ֣רְאוּ לָ֗מֹו ס֤וּרוּ ס֙וּרוּ֙ אַל־תִּגָּ֔עוּ כִּ֥י נָצ֖וּ גַּם־נָ֑עוּ אָֽמְרוּ֙ בַּגֹּויִ֔ם לֹ֥א יֹוסִ֖יפוּ לָגֽוּר׃ ס

H5493ס֣וּרוּsū-rū   (V-Qal-Imp-mp)
H5493 סוּר çûwr soor or שׂוּר; (Hosea 9:12), a primitive root; to turn off (literal or figurative); be(-head), bring, call back, decline, depart, eschew, get (you), go (aside), idiom grievous, lay away (by), leave undone, be past, pluck away, put (away, down), rebel, remove (to and fro), revolt, idiom be sour, take (away, off), turn (aside, away, in), withdraw, be without. 		ס֣וּרוּsū-rū Go away V-Qal-Imp-mp

H7121 קָרָא qârâʼ kaw-raw a primitive root (rather identical with קָרָא through the idea of accosting a person met); to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications); bewray (self), that are bidden, call (for, forth, self, upon), cry (unto), (be) famous, guest, invite, mention, (give) name, preach, (make) proclaim(-ation), pronounce, publish, read, renowned, say. 		קָ֣רְאוּqā-rə-’ū they cried out V-Qal-Perf-3cp

H5060תִּגָּ֔עוּtig-gā-‘ū,   (V-Qal-Imperf-2mp)
H5060 נָגַע nâgaʻ naw-gah a primitive root; properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.); beat, (idiom be able to) bring (down), cast, come (nigh), draw near (nigh), get up, happen, join, near, plague, reach (up), smite, strike, touch. 		תִּגָּ֔עוּtig-gā-‘ū, do touch us V-Qal-Imperf-2mp
H3588כִּ֥יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֥יkî when Conj
H5132נָצ֖וּnā-ṣū   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H5132 נוּץ nûwts noots a primitive root; properly, to flash; hence, to blossom (from the brilliancy of color); also, to fly away (from the quickness of motion); flee away, bud (forth). 		נָצ֖וּnā-ṣū they fled V-Qal-Perf-3cp
H1571גַּם־gam-   (Conj)
H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		גַּם־gam- and Conj
H5128נָ֑עוּnā-‘ū;   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H5128 נוּעַ nûwaʻ noo-ah a primitive root; to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined); continually, fugitive, idiom make, to (go) up and down, be gone away, (be) move(-able, -d), be promoted, reel, remove, scatter, set, shake, sift, stagger, to and fro, be vagabond, wag, (make) wander (up and down). 		נָ֑עוּnā-‘ū; wandered V-Qal-Perf-3cp

H1471 גּוֹי gôwy go-ee rarely (shortened) גֹּי; apparently from the same root as גֵּוָה (in the sense of massing); a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts; Gentile, heathen, nation, people., 		בַּגּוֹיִ֔םbag-gō-w-yim, among the nations Prep-b, Art | N-mp

H1481לָגֽוּר׃lā-ḡūr.   (Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf)
H1481 גּוּר gûwr goor a primitive root; properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid); abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, idiom surely. 		לָגֽוּר׃lā-ḡūr. dwell here Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf
15 They cried to them, Depart you; it is unclean; depart, depart, not touch: when they fled away and wandered, they said among the heathen, They will no more sojourn there.Lamentations 4:15
Stats
Counts: 173 characters, 21 words, 133 letters, 49 vowels, 84 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: ס֣וּרוּ טָמֵ֞א קָ֣רְאוּ לָ֗מֹו ס֤וּרוּ ס֙וּרוּ֙ אַל־תִּגָּ֔עוּ כִּ֥י נָצ֖וּ גַּם־נָ֑עוּ אָֽמְרוּ֙ בַּגֹּויִ֔ם לֹ֥א יֹוסִ֖יפוּ לָגֽוּר׃ ס

Lit: Go away unclean they cried out to them go away go away not do touch us when they fled and wandered Those said among the nations no they shall longer dwell here

KJV: They cried unto them, Depart ye; it is unclean; depart, depart, touch not: when they fled away and wandered, they said among the heathen, They shall no more sojourn [there].

 פְּנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ חִלְּקָ֔ם לֹ֥א יֹוסִ֖יף לְהַבִּיטָ֑ם פְּנֵ֤י כֹהֲנִים֙ לֹ֣א נָשָׂ֔אוּ [זְקֵנִים כ] (וּזְקֵנִ֖ים ק) לֹ֥א חָנָֽנוּ׃ ס

H6440פְּנֵ֤יpə-nê   (N-cpc)
H6440 פָּנִים pânîym paw-neem plural (but always as singular) of an unused noun פָּנֶה; from פָּנָה); the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.); phrase accept, a-(be-) fore(-time), against, anger, idiom as (long as), at, phrase battle, phrase because (of), phrase beseech, countenance, edge, phrase employ, endure, phrase enquire, face, favour, fear of, for, forefront(-part), form(-er time, -ward), from, front, heaviness, idiom him(-self), phrase honourable, phrase impudent, phrase in, it, look(-eth) (-s), idiom me, phrase meet, idiom more than, mouth, of, off, (of) old (time), idiom on, open, phrase out of, over against, the partial, person, phrase please, presence, propect, was purposed, by reason of, phrase regard, right forth, phrase serve, idiom shewbread, sight, state, straight, phrase street, idiom thee, idiom them(-selves), through (phrase -out), till, time(-s) past, (un-) to(-ward), phrase upon, upside (phrase down), with(-in, phrase -stand), idiom ye, idiom you. 		פְּנֵ֤יpə-nê The face N-cpc

H2603חָנָֽנוּ׃ḥā-nā-nū.   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H2603 חָנַן chânan khaw-nan a primitive root (compare חָנָה); properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition); beseech, idiom fair, (be, find, shew) favour(-able), be (deal, give, grant (gracious(-ly), intreat, (be) merciful, have (shew) mercy (on, upon), have pity upon, pray, make supplication, idiom very. 		חָנָֽנוּ׃ḥā-nā-nū. show favor to V-Qal-Perf-3cp
16 The anger of the LORD has divided them; He will no more regard them: they not respected the persons of the priests, they not favoured the elders.Lamentations 4:16
Stats
Counts: 146 characters, 24 words, 116 letters, 40 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פְּנֵ֤י יְהוָה֙ חִלְּקָ֔ם לֹ֥א יֹוסִ֖יף לְהַבִּיטָ֑ם פְּנֵ֤י כֹהֲנִים֙ לֹ֣א נָשָׂ֔אוּ [זְקֵנִים כ] (וּזְקֵנִ֖ים ק) לֹ֥א חָנָֽנוּ׃ ס

Lit: The face of Yahweh scattered them no longer He regards them the persons the priests not The people do respect the elders Nor show favor to

KJV: The anger of the LORD hath divided them; he will no more regard them: they respected not the persons of the priests, they favoured not the elders.
References

"hath"
Ge 49:7: Cursed be their anger: for it was fierce; and their wrath: for it was cruel: I will divide them in Jacob: and scatter them in Israel.
Le 26:33-39: I will scatter you among the heathen: and will draw out a sword after you: and your land will be desolate: and your cities waste.
De 28:25: 64: 65: The LORD will cause you to be smitten before your enemies: you will go out one way against them: and flee 7 ways before them: and will be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.
De 32:26: I said: I would scatter them into corners: I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:
Jer 15:4: I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth: because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah: for that which he did in Jerusalem.
Jer 24:9: I will deliver them to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth for their hurt: to be a reproach and a proverb: a taunt and a curse: in all places whither I will drive them.

"he will"
Ps 106:44: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction: when he heard their cry:
Heb 8:9: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they not continued in my covenant: and I regarded not them: says the Lord.

"they respected"
La 5:12: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders not were honoured.
2Ki 25:18-21: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest'>priest: and Zephaniah the second priest'>priest: and the 3 keepers of the door:
2Ch 36:17: Therefore he brought upon them the king of the Chaldees: who killed their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary: and had no compassion upon young man or maiden: old man: or him that stooped for age: he gave them all into his hand.
Isa 9:14-16: Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail: branch and rush: in one day.

 [עֹודֵינָה כ] (עֹודֵ֙ינוּ֙ ק) תִּכְלֶ֣ינָה עֵינֵ֔ינוּ אֶל־עֶזְרָתֵ֖נוּ הָ֑בֶל בְּצִפִּיָּתֵ֣נוּ צִפִּ֔ינוּ אֶל־גֹּ֖וי לֹ֥א יֹושִֽׁעַ׃ ס

17 As for us, our eyes as yet failed for our vain help: in our watching we have watched for a nation that not could save us.Lamentations 4:17
Stats
Counts: 123 characters, 23 words, 93 letters, 40 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: [עֹודֵינָה כ] (עֹודֵ֙ינוּ֙ ק) תִּכְלֶ֣ינָה עֵינֵ֔ינוּ אֶל־עֶזְרָתֵ֖נוּ הָ֑בֶל בְּצִפִּיָּתֵ֣נוּ צִפִּ֔ינוּ אֶל־גֹּ֖וי לֹ֥א יֹושִֽׁעַ׃ ס

Lit: Still us failed our eyes for our help Watching vainly in our watching we watched for a nation not that could save [us]

KJV: As for us, our eyes as yet failed for our vain help: in our watching we have watched for a nation that could not save [us].

Lit: They tracked our steps so that we could not walk in our streets was near Our end were over Our days for had come our end

KJV: They hunt our steps, that we cannot go in our streets: our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.

19 Our persecutors are swifter than the eagles of the heaven: they pursued us upon the mountains, they laid wait for us in the wilderness.Lamentations 4:19
Stats
Counts: 135 characters, 22 words, 109 letters, 44 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: קַלִּ֤ים הָיוּ֙ רֹדְפֵ֔ינוּ מִנִּשְׁרֵ֖י שָׁמָ֑יִם עַל־הֶהָרִ֣ים דְּלָקֻ֔נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר אָ֥רְבוּ לָֽנוּ׃ ס

Lit: Swifter were Our pursuers Than the eagles of the heavens on the mountains they pursued us in the wilderness And lay in wait for us

KJV: Our persecutors are swifter than the eagles of the heaven: they pursued us upon the mountains, they laid wait for us in the wilderness.

Mt 24:27: 28: For as the lightning comes out of the east: and shines even to the west; so will also the coming of the Son of man be.

"they pursued"

H7307ר֤וּחַrū-aḥ   (N-csc)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		ר֤וּחַrū-aḥ The breath N-csc

20 The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the LORD, was taken in their pits, of whom we said, Under His shadow we will live among the heathen.Lamentations 4:20
Stats
Counts: 145 characters, 24 words, 113 letters, 43 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: ר֤וּחַ אַפֵּ֙ינוּ֙ מְשִׁ֣יחַ יְהוָ֔ה נִלְכַּ֖ד בִּשְׁחִיתֹותָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְנוּ בְּצִלֹּ֖ו נִֽחְיֶ֥ה בַגֹּויִֽם׃ ס

Lit: The breath of our nostrils the anointed of Yahweh Was caught in their pits of whom we said Under his shadow we shall live among the nations

KJV: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the LORD, was taken in their pits, of whom we said, Under his shadow we shall live among the heathen.

21 Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, that dwell in the land of Uz; the cup also will pass through to you: you will be drunken, and will make yourself naked.Lamentations 4:21
Stats
Counts: 169 characters, 27 words, 132 letters, 47 vowels, 85 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׂ֤ישִׂי וְשִׂמְחִי֙ בַּת־אֱדֹ֔ום [יֹושַׁבְתִּי כ] (יֹושֶׁ֖בֶת ק) בְּאֶ֣רֶץ ע֑וּץ גַּם־עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ תַּעֲבָר־כֹּ֔וס תִּשְׁכְּרִ֖י וְתִתְעָרִֽי׃ ס

Lit: Rejoice and be glad daughter of Edom You who dwell in the land of Uz also to you shall pass over the cup and you shall become drunk and make yourself naked

KJV: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom, that dwellest in the land of Uz; the cup also shall pass through unto thee: thou shalt be drunken, and shalt make thyself naked.

"be glad"

"the land"

"the cup"

"and shalt"

Re 16:15: Look: I come as a thief. Blessed is he who watches: and keeps his garments: lest he walk naked: and they see his shame.

22 The punishment of your iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; he will no more carry you away into captivity: he will visit your iniquity, O daughter of Edom; he will discover your sins.Lamentations 4:22
Stats
Counts: 194 characters, 29 words, 155 letters, 61 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תַּם־עֲוֹנֵךְ֙ בַּת־צִיֹּ֔ון לֹ֥א יֹוסִ֖יף לְהַגְלֹותֵ֑ךְ פָּקַ֤ד עֲוֹנֵךְ֙ בַּת־אֱדֹ֔ום גִּלָּ֖ה עַל־חַטֹּאתָֽיִךְ׃ פ

Lit: Is accomplished The punishment of your iniquity daughter of Zion no He will longer send you into captivity He will punish your iniquity daughter of Edom He will uncover on your sins

KJV: The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion; he will no more carry thee away into captivity: he will visit thine iniquity, O daughter of Edom; he will discover thy sins.
References

"The punishment of thine iniquity"
La 4:6: For the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom: that was overthrown as in a moment: and no hands stayed on her.
Isa 40:2: Speak you comfortably to Jerusalem: and cry to her: that her warfare is accomplished: that her iniquity is pardoned: for she has received of the LORD's hand double for all her sins.
Jer 46:27: 28: But not fear you: O my servant Jacob: and not be dismayed: O Israel: for: look: I will save you from afar off: and your seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob will return: and be in rest and at ease: and none will make him afraid.
Jer 50:20: In those days: and in that time: says the LORD: the iniquity of Israel will be sought for: and there will be none; and the sins of Judah: and they will not be found: for I will pardon them whom I reserve.

"he will no"
Isa 52:1: Awake: awake; put on your strength: O Zion; put on your beautiful garments: O Jerusalem: the holy city: for henceforth there will no more come into you the uncircumcised and the unclean.
Isa 60:18: Violence will no more be heard in your land: wasting nor destruction within your borders; but you will call your walls Salvation: and your gates Praise.
Jer 32:40: I will make an everlasting covenant with them: that I not will turn away from them: to do them good; but I will put my fear in their hearts: that they will not depart from me.
Eze 37:28: The heathen will know that I the LORD do sanctify Israel: when my sanctuary will be in the middle of them for evermore.

"he will visit"
La 4:21: Rejoice and be glad: O daughter of Edom: that dwell in the land of Uz; the cup also will pass through to you: you will be drunken: and will make yourself naked.
Ps 137:7: Remember: O LORD: the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said: Rase it: rase it: even to the foundation thereof.

5
A Prayer for Restoration

זְכֹ֤ר יְהוָה֙ מֶֽה־הָ֣יָה לָ֔נוּ [הַבֵּיט כ] (הַבִּ֖יטָה ק) וּרְאֵ֥ה אֶת־חֶרְפָּתֵֽנוּ׃

H2142זְכֹ֤רzə-ḵōr   (V-Qal-Imp-ms)
H2142 זָכַר zâkar zaw-kar a primitive root; also as denominative from זָכָר; properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention; to be male; idiom burn (incense), idiom earnestly, be male, (make) mention (of), be mindful, recount, record(-er), remember, make to be remembered, bring (call, come, keep, put) to (in) remembrance, idiom still, think on, idiom well. 		זְכֹ֤רzə-ḵōr Remember V-Qal-Imp-ms

H4100מֶֽה־meh-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מֶֽה־meh- what Interrog

1 Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us: consider, and look our reproach.Lamentations 5:1
Stats
Counts: 74 characters, 9 words, 57 letters, 23 vowels, 34 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: זְכֹ֤ר יְהוָה֙ מֶֽה־הָ֣יָה לָ֔נוּ [הַבֵּיט כ] (הַבִּ֖יטָה ק) וּרְאֵ֥ה אֶת־חֶרְפָּתֵֽנוּ׃

Lit: Remember Yahweh what has come upon us Look and behold our reproach

KJV: Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.
References

"Remember"
La 1:20: Look: O LORD; for I am in distress: my bowels are troubled; my heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: abroad the sword bereaves: at home there is as death.
La 2:20: Look: O LORD: and consider to whom you have done this. Will the women eat their fruit: and children of a span long? will the priest and the prophet be killed in the sanctuary of the Lord?
La 3:19: Remembering my affliction and my misery: the wormwood and the gall.
Ne 1:8: Remember: I beseech you: the word that you commandedst your servant Moses: saying: If you transgress: I will scatter you abroad among the nations:
Job 7:7: O remember that my life is wind: my eye will no more see good.
Job 10:9: Remember: I beseech you: that you have made me as the clay; and will you bring me into dust again?
Jer 15:15: O LORD: you know: remember me: and visit me: and revenge me of my persecutors; take not me away in your longsuffering: know that for your sake I have suffered rebuke.
Hab 3:2: O LORD: I have heard your speech: and was afraid: O LORD: revive your work in the middle of the years: in the middle of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.
Lu 23:42: He said to Jesus: Lord: remember me when you come into your kingdom.

"behold"
La 2:15: All that pass by clap their hands at you; they hiss and wag their head at the daughter of Jerusalem: saying: Is this the city that men call The perfection of beauty: The joy of the whole earth?
La 3:61: You have heard their reproach: O LORD: and all their imaginations against me;
Ne 1:3: They said to me: The remnant that are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach: the wall of Jerusalem also is broken down: and the gates thereof are burned with fire.
Ne 4:4: Hear: O our God; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon their own head: and give them for a prey in the land of captivity:
Ps 44:13-16: You make us a reproach to our neighbours: a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
Ps 74:10: 11: O God: how long will the adversary reproach? will the enemy blaspheme your name for ever?
Ps 79:4: 12: We are become a reproach to our neighbours: a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.
Ps 89:50: 51: Remember: Lord: the reproach of your servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
Ps 123:3: 4: Have mercy upon us: O LORD: have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

"Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens."

Isa 5:17: Then will the lambs feed after their manner: and the waste places of the fat ones will strangers eat.
Isa 63:18: The people of your holiness have possessed it but a little while: our adversaries have trodden down your sanctuary.

Zep 1:13: Therefore their goods will become a booty: and their houses a desolation: they will also build houses: not but inhabit them; and they will plant vineyards: not but drink the wine thereof.

Stats
Counts: 57 characters, 9 words, 46 letters, 18 vowels, 28 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יְתֹומִ֤ים הָיִ֙ינוּ֙ [אֵין כ] (וְאֵ֣ין ק) אָ֔ב אִמֹּתֵ֖ינוּ כְּאַלְמָנֹֽות׃

Lit: Orphans we have become and waifs Our mothers are like widows

KJV: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.
References

"We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows."
Ex 22:24: My wrath will wax hot: and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives will be widows: and your children fatherless.
Jer 18:21: Therefore deliver up their children to the famine: and pour out their blood by the force of the sword; and let their wives be bereaved of their children: and be widows; and let their men be put to death; let their young men be killed by the sword in battle.
Ho 14:3: Asshur will not save us; we not will ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands: You are our gods: for in you the fatherless finds mercy.

Lit: to Egypt we have given our hand And Assyria to be satisfied with bread

KJV: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, [and to] the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
References

"given"
Ge 24:2: Abraham said to his eldest servant of his house: that ruled over all that he had: Put: I pray you: your hand under my thigh:
2Ki 10:15: When he was departed there: he lighted on Jehonadab the son of Rechab coming to meet him: and he saluted him: and said to him: Is your heart right: as my heart is with your heart? And Jehonadab answered: It is. If it be: give me your hand. And he gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.
Jer 50:15: Shout against her round about: she has given her hand: her foundations are fallen: her walls are thrown down: for it is the vengeance of the LORD: take vengeance upon her; as she has done: do to her.
Eze 17:18: Seeing he despised the oath by breaking the covenant: when: indeed: he had given his hand: and has done all these things: he will not escape.

"to the Egyptians"

Isa 57:9: you went to the king with ointment: and did increase your perfumes: and did send your messengers far off: and did debase yourself even to hell.
Jer 2:18: 36: Now what have you to do in the way of Egypt: to drink the waters of Sihor? or what have you to do in the way of Assyria: to drink the waters of the river?

Ho 5:13: When Ephraim saw his sickness: and Judah saw his wound: then went Ephraim to the Assyrian: and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you: nor cure you of your wound.
Ho 7:11: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt: they go to Assyria.
Ho 9:3: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.

Translation
Hebrew: אֲבֹתֵ֤ינוּ חָֽטְאוּ֙ [אֵינָם כ] (וְאֵינָ֔ם ק) [אֲנַחְנוּ כ] (וַאֲנַ֖חְנוּ ק) עֲוֹנֹתֵיהֶ֥ם סָבָֽלְנוּ׃

Lit: Our fathers sinned and [are no more we but we their iniquities bear

KJV: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.
References

"fathers"
Ex 20:5: You will not bow down yourself to them: nor serve them: for I the LORD your God am a jealous God: visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generation of them that hate me;
Jer 16:12: you have done worse than your fathers; for: look: you walk every one after the imagination of his evil heart: that they not may listen to me:
Jer 31:29: In those days they will say no more: The fathers have eaten a sour grape: and the children's teeth are set on edge.
Eze 18:2: What mean you: that you use this proverb concerning the land of Israel: saying: The fathers have eaten sour grapes: and the children's teeth are set on edge?
Mt 23:32-36: Fill you up then the measure of your fathers.

"and are"
Ge 42:13: 36: They said: Your servants are 12 brothers: the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and: look: the youngest is this day with our father: and one is not.
Job 7:8: 21: The eye of him that has seen me will see me no more: your eyes are upon me: and I am not.
Jer 31:15: Thus says the LORD; A voice was heard in Ramah: lamentation: and bitter weeping; Rahel weeping for her children refused to be comforted for her children: because they were not.
Zec 1:5: your fathers: where are they? and the prophets: do they live for ever?

H369אֵ֥ין’ên   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. H3027מִיָּדָֽם׃mî-yā-ḏām.   (Prep-m | N-fsc | 3mp)
H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		מִיָּדָֽם׃mî-yā-ḏām. from their hand Prep-m | N-fsc | 3mp
8 Servants have ruled over us: there is none that does deliver us out of their hand.Lamentations 5:8
Stats
Counts: 84 characters, 13 words, 65 letters, 26 vowels, 39 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עֲבָדִים֙ מָ֣שְׁלוּ בָ֔נוּ פֹּרֵ֖ק אֵ֥ין מִיָּדָֽם׃

Lit: Servants rule over us to deliver us There is none from their hand

KJV: Servants have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver [us] out of their hand.
References

"Servants"
Ge 9:25: He said: Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants will he be to his brothers.
De 28:43: The stranger that is within you will get up above you very high; and you will come down very low.
Ne 2:19: But when Sanballat the Horonite: and Tobiah the servant: the Ammonite: and Geshem the Arabian: heard it: they laughed us to scorn: and despised us: and said: What is this thing that you do? will you rebel against the king?
Ne 5:15: But the former governors that had been before me were chargeable to the people: and had taken of them bread and wine: beside 40 shekels of silver; yes: even their servants bare rule over the people: but so not did I: because of the fear of God.
Pr 30:22: For a servant when he reigns; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

"there"
Job 5:4: His children are far from safety: and they are crushed in the gate: neither is there any to deliver them.
Job 10:7: You know that I not am wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of your hand.
Ps 7:2: Lest he tear my soul like a lion: rending it in pieces: while there is none to deliver.
Ps 50:22: Now consider this: you that forget God: lest I tear you in pieces: and there be none to deliver.
Isa 43:13: Yes: before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work: and who will let it?
Ho 2:10: Now will I discover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers: and none will deliver her out of my hand.
Zec 11:6: For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land: says the LORD: but: indeed: I will deliver the men every one into His neighbour's hand: and into the hand of His king: and they will smite the land: and out of their hand I not will deliver them.

12 Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders not were honoured.Lamentations 5:12
Stats
Counts: 75 characters, 13 words, 60 letters, 23 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שָׂרִים֙ בְּיָדָ֣ם נִתְל֔וּ פְּנֵ֥י זְקֵנִ֖ים לֹ֥א נֶהְדָּֽרוּ׃

Lit: Princes by their hands were hung up the faces elders not and were respected

KJV: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.
References

"Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured."
La 2:10: 20: The elders of the daughter of Zion sit upon the ground: and keep silence: they have cast up dust upon their heads; they have girded themselves with sackcloth: the virgins of Jerusalem hang down their heads to the ground.
La 4:16: The anger of the LORD has divided them; He will no more regard them: they not respected the persons of the priests: they not favoured the elders.
Isa 47:6: I was angry with my people: I have polluted my inheritance: and given them into your hand: you did show them no mercy; upon the ancient have you very heavily laid your yoke.
Jer 39:6: 7: Then the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes: also the king of Babylon killed all the nobles of Judah.
Jer 52:10: 11: 25-27: The king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he killed also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.

KJV: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.

Job 31:10: Then let my wife grind to another: and let others bow down upon her.
Isa 47:2: Take the millstones: and grind meal: uncover your locks: make bare the leg: uncover the thigh: pass over the rivers.

"fell"

Ex 23:5: If you see the ass of him that hates you lying under his burden: and would forbear to help him: you will surely help with him.
Ne 5:1-5: There was a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.

Mt 23:4: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne: and lay them on men's shoulders; but they themselves not will move them with one of their fingers.

Lit: The elders at] the gate have ceased gathering and the young men from their music

KJV: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.

"elders"

"the young"

H4994 נָא nâʼ naw a primitive particle of incitement and entreaty, which may usually be rendered; I pray, now, or then; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction; I beseech (pray) thee (you), go to, now, oh., 		נָ֥אnā I beseech thee Interjection

H3588כִּ֥יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֥יkî for Conj
H2398חָטָֽאנוּ׃ḥā-ṭā-nū.   (V-Qal-Perf-1cp)
H2398 חָטָא châṭâʼ khaw-taw a primitive root; properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn; bear the blame, cleanse, commit (sin), by fault, harm he hath done, loss, miss, (make) offend(-er), offer for sin, purge, purify (self), make reconciliation, (cause, make) sin(-ful, -ness), trespass. 		חָטָֽאנוּ׃ḥā-ṭā-nū. we have sinned V-Qal-Perf-1cp

Counts: 68 characters, 12 words, 52 letters, 21 vowels, 31 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נָֽפְלָה֙ עֲטֶ֣רֶת רֹאשֵׁ֔נוּ אֹֽוי־נָ֥א לָ֖נוּ כִּ֥י חָטָֽאנוּ׃

Lit: Has fallen the crown from our head Woe I beseech thee to us for we have sinned

KJV: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!
References

"The crown"
La 1:1: How does the city sit solitary: that was full of people! how is she become as a widow! she that was great among the nations: and princess among the provinces: how is she become tributary!
Job 19:9: He has stripped me of my glory: and taken the crown from my head.
Ps 89:39: You have made void the covenant of your servant: you have profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
Jer 13:18: Say to the king and to the queen: Humble yourselves: sit down: for your principalities will come down: even the crown of your glory.
Eze 21:26: Thus says the Lord GOD; Remove the diadem: and take off the crown: this will not be the same: exalt Him that is low: and abase Him that is high.
Re 2:10: Fear none of those things which you will suffer: look: the devil will cast some of you into prison: that you may be tried; and you will have tribulation 10 days: be you faithful to death: and I will give you a crown of life.
Re 3:11: Look: I come quickly: hold that fast which you have: that no man take your crown.

"woe"
La 1:8: 18: Jerusalem has grievously sinned; therefore she is removed: all that honoured her despise her: because they have seen her nakedness: yes: she sighes: and turns backward.
La 2:1: How has the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in His anger: and cast down from heaven to the earth the beauty of Israel: and not remembered His footstool in the day of His anger!
La 4:13: For the sins of her prophets: and the iniquities of her priests: that have shed the blood of the just in the middle of her:
Pr 14:34: Righteousness exalts a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
Isa 3:9-11: The show of their face does witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom: they hide it not. Woe to their soul! for they have rewarded evil to themselves.
Jer 2:17: 19: Have you not procured this to yourself: in that you have forsaken the LORD your God: when He led you by the way?
Jer 4:18: Your way and your doings have procured these things to you; this is your wickedness: because it is bitter: because it reaches to your heart.
Eze 7:17-22: All hands will be feeble: and all knees will be weak as water.
Eze 22:12-16: In you have they taken gifts to shed blood; you have taken usury and increase: and you have greedily gained of your neighbours by extortion: and have forgotten me: says the Lord GOD.
2Pe 2:4-6: For if God not spared the angels that sinned: but cast them down to hell: and delivered them into chains of darkness: to be reserved to judgment;

 עַל־זֶ֗ה הָיָ֤ה דָוֶה֙ לִבֵּ֔נוּ עַל־אֵ֖לֶּה חָשְׁכ֥וּ עֵינֵֽינוּ׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- because Prep
H2088זֶ֗הzeh,   (Pro-ms)
H2088 זֶה zeh zeh a primitive word; the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that; he, idiom hence, idiom here, it(-self), idiom now, idiom of him, the one...the other, idiom than the other, (idiom out of) the (self) same, such (a one) that, these, this (hath, man), on this side...on that side, idiom thus, very, which. Compare זֹאת, זֹה, זוֹ, זוּ., 		זֶ֗הzeh, of this Pro-ms
H1961הָיָ֤הhā-yāh   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms)
H1961 הָיָה hâyâh haw-yaw a primitive root (compare הָוָא); to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary); beacon, idiom altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall, phrase follow, happen, idiom have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, idiom use. 		הָיָ֤הhā-yāh is V-Qal-Perf-3ms

H5869 עַיִן ʻayin ah-yin probably a primitive word; an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape); affliction, outward appearance, phrase before, phrase think best, colour, conceit, phrase be content, countenance, phrase displease, eye((-brow), (-d), -sight), face, phrase favour, fountain, furrow (from the margin), idiom him, phrase humble, knowledge, look, (phrase well), idiom me, open(-ly), phrase (not) please, presence, phrase regard, resemblance, sight, idiom thee, idiom them, phrase think, idiom us, well, idiom you(-rselves). 		עֵינֵֽינוּ׃‘ê-nê-nū. our eyes N-cdc | 1cp
17 For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.Lamentations 5:17
Stats
Counts: 63 characters, 12 words, 49 letters, 20 vowels, 29 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַל־זֶ֗ה הָיָ֤ה דָוֶה֙ לִבֵּ֔נוּ עַל־אֵ֖לֶּה חָשְׁכ֥וּ עֵינֵֽינוּ׃

Lit: because of this is faint our heart because of these things grow dim our eyes

KJV: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.
References

"our heart"
La 1:13: 22: From above has he sent fire into my bones: and it prevails against them: he has spread a net for my feet: he has turned me back: he has made me desolate and faint all the day.
Le 26:36: Upon them that are left alive of you I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a shaken leaf will chase them; and they will flee: as fleeing from a sword; and they will fall when none pursues.
Isa 1:5: Why should you be stricken any more? you will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick: and the whole heart faint.
Jer 8:18: When I would comfort myself against sorrow: my heart is faint in me.
Jer 46:5: For what reason have I seen them dismayed and turned away back? and their mighty ones are beaten down: and are fled apace: and not look back: for fear was round about: says the LORD.
Eze 21:7: 15: It will be: when they say to you: For what reason sigh you? that you will answer: For the tidings; because it comes'>comes: and every heart will melt: and all hands will be feeble: and every spirit will faint: and all knees will be weak as water: look: it comes'>comes: and will be brought to pass: says the Lord GOD.
Mic 6:13: Therefore also will I make you sick in smiting you: in making you desolate because of your sins.

"our eyes"
La 2:11: My eyes do fail with tears: my bowels are troubled: my liver is poured upon the earth: for the destruction of the daughter of my people; because the children and the sucklings swoon in the streets of the city.
De 28:65: Among these nations will you find no ease: neither will the sole of your foot have rest: but the LORD will give you there a trembling heart: and failing of eyes: and sorrow of mind:
Job 17:7: My eye also is dim by reason of sorrow: and all my members are as a shadow.
Ps 6:7: My eye is consumed because of grief; it waxs old because of all my enemies.
Ps 31:9: Have mercy upon me: O LORD: for I am in trouble: my eye is consumed with grief: yes: my soul and my belly.
Ps 69:3: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: my eyes fail while I wait for my God.
Isa 38:14: Like a crane or a swallow: so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: my eyes fail with looking upward: O LORD: I am oppressed; undertake for me.

Translation

Lit: Because of Mount Zion which is desolate with foxes walking about on it

KJV: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.
References

"of the"

1Ki 9:7: 8: Then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house: which I have hallowed for my name: will I cast out of my sight; and Israel will be a proverb and a byword among all people:

Jer 17:3: O my mountain in the field: I will give your substance and all your treasures to the spoil: and your high places for sin: throughout all your borders.
Jer 26:9: Why have you prophesied in the name of the LORD: saying: This house will be like Shiloh: and this city will be desolate without an inhabitant? And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the LORD.
Jer 52:13: Burned the house of the LORD: and the king's house; and all the houses of Jerusalem: and all the houses of the great men: burned He with fire:
Mic 3:12: Therefore will Zion for your sake be plowed as a field: and Jerusalem will become heaps: and the mountain of the house as the high places of the for.

"the foxes"

Jer 9:11: I will make Jerusalem heaps: and a den of dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah desolate: without an inhabitant.

H3069יְהוָה֙Yah-weh   (N-proper-ms)
H3069 יְהֹוִה Yᵉhôvih yeh-ho-vee a variation of יְהֹוָה (used after אֲדֹנָי, and pronounced by Jews as אֱלֹהִים, in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce יְהֹוָה as אֲדֹנָי); {YHWH}; God. 		יְהוָה֙Yah-weh Yahweh N-proper-ms
H5769לְעוֹלָ֣םlə-‘ō-w-lām   (Prep-l | N-ms)
H5769 עוֹלָם ʻôwlâm o-lawm or עֹלָם; from עָלַם; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always; alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world (phrase without end). Compare נֶצַח, עַד. 		לְעוֹלָ֣םlə-‘ō-w-lām forever Prep-l | N-ms

19 You, O LORD, remain for ever; your throne from generation to generation.Lamentations 5:19
Stats
Counts: 75 characters, 9 words, 60 letters, 25 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לְעֹולָ֣ם תֵּשֵׁ֔ב כִּסְאֲךָ֖ לְדֹ֥ר וָדֹֽור׃

Lit: You Yahweh forever remain Your throne from generation and to generation

KJV: Thou, O LORD, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.
References

"remainest"
De 33:27: The eternal God is your refuge: and underneath are the everlasting arms: and He will thrust out the enemy from before you; and will say: Destroy them.
Ps 9:7: But the LORD will endure for ever: He has prepared His throne for judgment.
Ps 10:16: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of His land.
Ps 29:10: The LORD sits'>sits upon the flood; yes: the LORD sits'>sits King for ever.
Ps 90:2: Before the mountains were brought forth: or ever you hadst formed the earth and the world: even from everlasting to everlasting: you are God.
Ps 102:12: 25-27: But you: O LORD: will endure for ever; and your remembrance to all generations.
Hab 1:12: Are you not from everlasting: O LORD my God: my Holy one? we will not die. O LORD: you have ordained them for judgment; and: O mighty God: you have established them for correction.
1Ti 1:17: Now to the King eternal: immortal: invisible: the only wise God: be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
1Ti 6:15: 16: Which in His times He will show: who is the blessed and only Potentate: the King of kings: and Lord of lords;
Heb 1:10-12: And: You: Lord: in the beginning have laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of your hands:
Heb 13:8: Jesus Christ the same yesterday: and today: and for ever.
Re 1:4: 8: 17: 18: John to the 7 churches which are in Asia: Grace be to you: and peace: from Him which is: and which was: and which is to come; and from the 7 Spirits which are before His throne;

"thy throne"
Ps 45:6: Your throne: O God: is for ever and ever: the sceptre of your kingdom is a right sceptre.
Ps 145:13: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom: and your dominion endureth throughout all generations.
Ps 146:10: The LORD will reign for ever: even your God: O Zion: to all generations. Praise you the LORD.
Da 2:44: In the days of these kings will the God of heaven set up a kingdom: which will never be destroyed: and the kingdom will not be left to other people: but it will break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms: and it will stand for ever.
Da 7:14: 27: There was given him dominion: and glory: and a kingdom: that all people: nations: and languages: should serve him: his dominion is an everlasting dominion: which will not pass away: and his kingdom that which will not be destroyed.
Heb 1:8: 9: But to the Son He says: Your throne: O God: is for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of your kingdom.

 לָ֤מָּה לָנֶ֙צַח֙ תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֔נוּ תַּֽעַזְבֵ֖נוּ לְאֹ֥רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H4100לָ֤מָּהlām-māh   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		לָ֤מָּהlām-māh Why Interrog
H5331לָנֶ֙צַח֙lā-ne-ṣaḥ   (Prep-l | N-ms)
H5331 נֶצַח netsach neh-tsakh or נֵצַח; from נָצַח; properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view); alway(-s), constantly, end, (phrase n-) ever(more), perpetual, strength, victory. 		לָנֶ֙צַח֙lā-ne-ṣaḥ forever Prep-l | N-ms
H7911תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֔נוּtiš-kā-ḥê-nū,   (V-Qal-Imperf-2ms | 1cp)
H7911 שָׁכַח shâkach shaw-kakh or שָׁכֵחַ; a primitive root; to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention; idiom at all, (cause to) forget. 		תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֔נוּtiš-kā-ḥê-nū, do You forget us V-Qal-Imperf-2ms | 1cp

H5800 עָזַב ʻâzab aw-zab a primitive root; to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.; commit self, fail, forsake, fortify, help, leave (destitute, off), refuse, idiom surely. 		תַּֽעַזְבֵ֖נוּta-‘az-ḇê-nū And forsake us V-Qal-Imperf-2ms | 1cp

H3117יָמִֽים׃yā-mîm.   (N-mp)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		יָמִֽים׃yā-mîm. a time N-mp
20 For what reason do you forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?Lamentations 5:20
Stats
Counts: 68 characters, 12 words, 54 letters, 22 vowels, 32 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה לָנֶ֙צַח֙ תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֔נוּ תַּֽעַזְבֵ֖נוּ לְאֹ֥רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃

Lit: Why forever do You forget us And forsake us for so long a time

KJV: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?
References

"dost"
Ps 13:1: A Psalm of David.>> How long will you forget me: O LORD? for ever? how long will you hide your face from me?
Ps 44:24: For what reason hid you your face: and forget our affliction and our oppression?
Ps 74:1: > O God: why have you cast us off for ever? why does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture?
Ps 77:7-10: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will He be favourable no more?
Ps 79:5: How long: LORD? will you be angry for ever? will your jealousy burn like fire?
Ps 85:5: Will you be angry with us for ever? will you draw out your anger to all generations?
Ps 89:46: How long: LORD? will you hide yourself for ever? will your wrath burn like fire?
Ps 94:3: 4: LORD: how long will the wicked: how long will the wicked triumph?
Isa 64:9-12: not Be angry very sore: O LORD: neither remember iniquity for ever: look: see: we beseech you: we are all your people.
Jer 14:19-21: Have you utterly rejected Judah? has your soul lothed Zion? why have you smitten us: and there is no healing for us? we looked for peace: and there is no good; and for the time of healing: and look trouble!
